attributes.action: Award the late Jock Stein a Knighthood for Services to British and European Football
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Jock Stein created history being the first British manager to win the then European Cup with Celtic FC, breaking the Latin Bond on the Trophy. This set a great precedent for British football with Manchester United winning the Cup a year later. 

Alex Fergusson was a awarded a Knighthood for winning the trophy, so why can the Late, Great Jock Stein not be awarded the same? Afterall he did it when the odds were against him with a team of guys from very nearly the same city and no foreign influence. A truly remarkable achievement.

rejection.details: Sorry but we can no longer accept posthumous award requests.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
